text: [Music]
my name is Mark King I'm an enterprise
leader here in the UK and I've been here
for three and a half years the reason I
came to AWS in the first place was it
was the ability to have an impact on
customers I work with an incredible team
focused on some of the most complex
customers here in the UK helping them
achieve their business outcomes which is
normally around some kind of
transformation I'd worked at a number of
organizations before great products
great tool sets but it's really the
culture that I was looking for after
reviewing the leadership principles it
very quickly became apparent to me that
this is just somewhere that really
aligns what I believed in in order to
work before coming here I read up on the
leadership principles I I read about
customer obsession I read about
ownership all these things it was a bit
unclear to me kind of what it actually
meant and then kind of as I went through
the interview process it was clear that
this is something that embodied what
everyone AWS is about I was able to
understand how people did their their
day to day jobs by taking ownership by
taking wise fraction and all these
things it was clear based on the way AWS
was growing in the market was having an
impact it really was having a customer
alka if I was to sum up my time here at
AWS so far in one word it would be
insightful I'm exposed now to customers
that are trying to achieve so many great
things we have so many great
capabilities ourselves as AWS we have
such a great ecosystem I upon learning
all the time
which means I'm able to develop my own
thinking which in turn I'm able to
provide insight to our customers yes if
I was to give advice to someone joining
AWS you'd have to be about enjoying it
you know AWS just has so many
possibilities so many options so many
great things to do on a day to day basis
even a fantastic company take that time
at the beginning to kind of learn as
much as possible and to enjoy it and
then and then take that take that to
customers and talk about how AWS can
really hook
